w:r.w:t: LTE SRS MATLAB Workflow (Word XML)

This WordprocessingML file can be opened directly in Word or saved as a .docx without introducing binary assets. It mirrors the MATLAB README so it can be included in PRs where binary files are blocked.
1. Overview

The MATLAB port reproduces the LTE Sounding Reference Signal creator, tester, and report generator. All helper functions live in the +lte_srs package, while srs_tester.m and srs_report.m provide quick validation and PDF reporting.
2. Key Parameters
- cell_id: Physical cell ID used in Gold sequence generation.
- bandwidth_config (C_srs): SRS bandwidth index selecting resource allocations.
- subframe_config (T_srs): Periodicity pattern controlling active subframes.
- b_hop: Hopping bandwidth configuration.
- group_hopping_enabled / sequence_hopping_enabled: PRS and root index hopping options.
- transmission_comb (k_tc): Even/odd comb selection for subcarrier mapping.
- cyclic_shift (n_cs): Applies a cyclic phase shift to decorrelate UEs.
- srs_bandwidth (B_srs) and n_ul_rb: Choose occupied bandwidth and uplink grid size.
3. Processing Steps
Setup:
- cfg = lte_srs.create_config(...) builds a validated structure for each UE.
- lte_srs.is_active_subframe(cfg, n_sf) tests whether subframe n_sf carries SRS.
Signal path:
- Root and cyclic shift: lte_srs.generate_zadoff_chu plus lte_srs.apply_cyclic_shift.
- Hopping: lte_srs.group_and_sequence_hopping selects the active root u(n) and q(n).
- Mapping: lte_srs.map_to_frequency_grid applies comb spacing and RB allocation.
- OFDM symbol: lte_srs.generate_srs returns the complex baseband vector and metadata.
4. Validation and Reporting
- srs_tester.m builds multiple UE configs, synthesizes their SRS, and plots the normalized cross-correlation matrix.
- srs_report.m (MATLAB Report Generator) assembles a PDF with configuration tables, per-UE constellation/time plots, hopping spectrograms, and the correlation heatmap.
5. Quick Commands
addpath('matlab');
srs_tester; % run validation and save correlation_matrix.png
srs_report; % produce matlab/srs_report.pdf
